meanings.definition: A form of gambling in which a prize or prizes are awarded to winners selected at random.
meanings.sent1: My grandma won a sweepstake and got a big prize!
meanings.sent2: Entering a sweepstake can be exciting as you might win a prize.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the mouse was a sweepstake and chased it around the house.
meanings.sent4: Life is like a sweepstake, you never know what prize you might get.
meanings.sent5: The sweepstake at the fair had everyone eagerly waiting to see who would win.

meanings.definition: A ticket or entry in a sweepstake.
meanings.sent1: She held the winning sweepstake in her hand with a big smile.
meanings.sent2: Buying a sweepstake can give you a chance to win amazing prizes.
meanings.sent3: The dog thought the sweepstake was a tasty treat and tried to eat it.
meanings.sent4: His lucky sweepstake was the key to winning the grand prize.
meanings.sent5: The crumpled sweepstake lay forgotten on the kitchen table, waiting to be filled out.
